verses.verse: And there was a famine <WH7458> in the land <WH776>, besides <WH905> the first <WH7223> famine <WH7458> that was in the days <WH3117> of Abraham <WH85>. And Isaac <WH3327> went <WH3212> unto Abimelech <WH40> king <WH4428> of the Philistines <WH6430>, unto Gerar <WH1642>.
And Jehovah <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> unto him <WH559>, and said, Go not down <WH3381> into Egypt <WH4714>; dwell <WH7931> in the land <WH776> which I shall tell thee of <WH559>:

sojourn <WH1481> in this land <WH776>, and I will be with thee <WH1288>, and will bless thee <WH2233>; for unto thee, and unto thy seed, I will give <WH5414> all these <WH411> lands <WH776>, and I will establish <WH6965> the oath <WH7621> which I sware <WH7650> unto Abraham <WH85> thy father <WH1>;

and I will multiply <WH7235> thy seed <WH2233> as the stars <WH3556> of heaven <WH8064>, and will give <WH5414> unto thy seed <WH2233> all these <WH411> lands <WH2233>; and in thy seed shall all the nations <WH1471> of the earth <WH776> be blessed <WH1288>;
because <WH6118> that Abraham <WH85> obeyed <WH8085> my voice <WH6963>, and kept <WH8104> my charge <WH4931>, my commandments <WH4687>, my statutes <WH2708>, and my laws <WH8451>.
And Isaac <WH3327> dwelt <WH3427> in Gerar <WH1642>:

and the men <WH582> of the place <WH4725> asked <WH7592> him of his wife <WH802>; and he said <WH559>, She is my sister <WH269>: for he feared <WH3372> to say <WH559>, My wife <WH802>; lest <WH582>, said he, the men of the place <WH4725> should kill <WH2026> me for Rebekah <WH7259>; because she was fair <WH2896> to look upon <WH4758>.

And it came to pass <WH748>, when he had been there a long time <WH3117>, that Abimelech <WH40> king <WH4428> of the Philistines <WH6430> looked out <WH8259> at <WH1157> a window <WH2474>, and saw <WH7200>, and <WH3327>, behold, Isaac was sporting <WH6711> with Rebekah <WH7259> his wife <WH802>.

And Abimelech <WH40> called <WH7121> Isaac <WH3327>, and said <WH559>, Behold <WH389>, of a surety she is thy wife <WH802>: and how saidst <WH559> thou <WH269>, She is my sister? And Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> unto him <WH559>, Because I said, Lest I die because of her <WH4191>.

And Abimelech <WH40> said <WH559>, What is this thou hast done <WH6213> unto us <WH259>? One of the people <WH5971> might easily <WH4592> have lain <WH7901> with thy wife <WH802>, and thou wouldest have brought <WH935> guiltiness upon us <WH817>.
And Abimelech <WH40> charged <WH6680> all the people <WH5971>, saying <WH559>, He that toucheth <WH5060> this man <WH376> or his wife <WH802> shall surely <WH4191> be put to death <WH4191>.
And Isaac <WH3327> sowed <WH2232> in that land <WH776>, and found <WH4672> in the same year <WH8141> a hundredfold <WH3967>: and Jehovah <WH3068> blessed him <WH1288>.
And the man <WH376> waxed great <WH1431>, and grew <WH1432> more <WH3212> and more <WH1980> until he became <WH1431> very <WH3966> great <WH1431>:
and he had possessions <WH4735> of flocks <WH6629>, and possessions <WH4735> of herds <WH1241>, and a great <WH7227> household <WH5657>: and the Philistines <WH6430> envied him <WH7065>.

Now all the wells <WH875> which his father <WH1>'s servants <WH5650> had digged <WH2658> in the days <WH3117> of Abraham <WH85> his father <WH1>, the Philistines <WH6430> had stopped <WH5640>, and filled <WH4390> with earth <WH6083>.
And Abimelech <WH40> said <WH559> unto Isaac <WH3327>, Go <WH3212> from us <WH3966>; for thou art much mightier than we <WH6105>.
And Isaac <WH3327> departed <WH3212> thence <WH2583>, and encamped in the valley <WH5158> of Gerar <WH1642>, and dwelt <WH3427> there <WH8033>.

And Isaac <WH3327> digged <WH2658> again <WH7725> the wells <WH875> of water <WH4325>, which they had digged <WH2658> in the days <WH3117> of Abraham <WH85> his father <WH1>; for the Philistines <WH6430> had stopped <WH5640> them after <WH310> the death <WH4194> of Abraham <WH85>; and he called <WH7121> their names <WH8034> after the names <WH8034> by which <WH834> his father <WH1> had called them <WH7121>.
And Isaac <WH3327>'s servants <WH5650> digged <WH2658> in the valley <WH5158>, and found <WH4672> there a well <WH875> of springing <WH2416> water <WH4325>.

And the herdsmen <WH7462> of Gerar <WH1642> strove <WH7378> with Isaac <WH3327>'s herdsmen <WH7462>, saying <WH559>, The water <WH4325> is ours <WH7121>: and he called the name <WH8034> of the well <WH875> Esek <WH6230>, because they contended with him <WH6229>.
And they digged <WH2658> another <WH312> well <WH875>, and they strove <WH7378> for that also <WH7121>: and he called the name of it <WH8034> Sitnah <WH7856>.

And he removed <WH6275> from thence <WH2658>, and digged another <WH312> well <WH875>; and for that they strove <WH7378> not <WH7121>: and he called the name of it <WH8034> Rehoboth <WH7344>; and he said <WH559>, For now <WH6258> Jehovah <WH3068> hath made room <WH7337> for us <WH6509>, and we shall be fruitful in the land <WH776>.
And he went up <WH5927> from thence to Beer-sheba <WH884>.

And Jehovah <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> unto him the same night <WH3915>, and said <WH559>, I am the God <WH430> of Abraham <WH85> thy father <WH1>: fear <WH3372> not <WH854>, for I am with thee <WH1288>, and will bless thee <WH7235>, and multiply thy seed <WH2233> for my servant <WH5650> Abraham <WH85>'s sake.

And he builded <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> there <WH7121>, and called upon the name <WH8034> of Jehovah <WH3068>, and pitched <WH5186> his tent <WH168> there <WH3327>: and there Isaac's servants <WH5650> digged <WH3738> a well <WH875>.
Then Abimelech <WH40> went <WH1980> to him from Gerar <WH1642>, and Ahuzzath <WH276> his friend <WH4828>, and Phicol <WH6369> the captain <WH8269> of his host <WH6635>.
And Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> unto them <WH4069>, Wherefore are ye come <WH935> unto me <WH8130>, seeing ye hate me <WH7971>, and have sent me away from you?

And they said <WH559>, We saw <WH7200> plainly <WH7200> that Jehovah <WH3068> was with thee <WH559>: and we said, Let there now be an oath <WH423> betwixt <WH996> us <WH996>, even betwixt us and thee <WH3772>, and let us make a covenant with thee <WH1285>,

that thou wilt do <WH6213> us no hurt <WH7451>, as we have not touched <WH5060> thee <WH6213>, and as we have done unto thee nothing but <WH7535> good <WH2896>, and have sent thee away <WH7971> in peace <WH7965>: thou art now <WH6258> the blessed <WH1288> of Jehovah <WH3068>.
And he made <WH6213> them a feast <WH4960>, and they did eat <WH398> and drink <WH8354>.

And they rose up betimes <WH7925> in the morning <WH1242>, and sware <WH7650> one <WH376> to another <WH251>: and Isaac <WH3327> sent them away <WH7971>, and they departed <WH3212> from him in peace <WH7965>.

And it came to pass the same day <WH3117>, that Isaac <WH3327>'s servants <WH5650> came <WH935>, and told <WH5046> him concerning <WH182> the well <WH875> which they had digged <WH2658>, and said <WH559> unto him <WH4672>, We have found water <WH4325>.
And he called <WH7121> it Shibah <WH7656>: therefore the name <WH8034> of the city <WH5892> is Beer-sheba <WH884> unto this day <WH3117>.

And when Esau <WH6215> was forty <WH705> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> he took <WH3947> to wife <WH802> Judith <WH3067> the daughter <WH1323> of Beeri <WH882> the Hittite <WH2850>, and Basemath <WH1315> the daughter <WH1323> of Elon <WH356> the Hittite <WH2850>:
and they were a grief <WH4786> of mind <WH7307> unto Isaac <WH3327> and to Rebekah <WH7259>.
